intro: Satureja montana var. subspicata, commonly known as alpine savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its essential oils contain compounds like thymol and carvacrol, which contribute to its distinctive fragrance and medicinal properties. It is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its antiseptic and digestive benefits.
